newsitem.title: FINLAND: RESEARCH ALERT - SALOMON KEEPS BUY ON TAMRO .
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - SALOMON KEEPS BUY ON TAMRO .

text.p: Wall Street investment bank Salomon Brothers said in a report dated June 11 it maintained its buy stance on Finnish pharmaceuticals wholesaler Tamro Oy and raised its earnings estimates and price target.
"We are raising our price target to 42 markka," it said.
Five-year compound growth in earnings per share would be 14 percent, with 24 percent growth in 1998 driving share price gains, it said.
The report was based on a share price of 36.7 markka. Tamro closed at 37.00 markka on Friday and was untraded by 1105/0805 GMT on Monday.

The price target represented 18 times Salomon's 1998 EPS forecast and was based on the raised estimates, Tamro's Novartis Sweden contract, increased confidence in the Nordic concept, Tamro's modest premium to the European sector, and a 39 percent discound to Gehe on Salomon's estimates, it said.
